books.title: Darkwater
books.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
books.summary: A collection of essays, short fiction, and poetry related to the lives of black people in Jim Crow-era America.

books.title: Lorna Doone
books.author: R. D. Blackmore
books.summary: A young yeoman farmer falls in love with a beautiful girl who belongs to the outlaw clan which killed his father.

books.title: A Yankee in the Trenches
books.author: Robert Derby Holmes
books.summary: An American describes his experiences in the British Army in the First World War.

books.title: Queen Victoria
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: A sardonic and generally unflattering biography of Victoria Alexandrina, Queen of England.

books.title: The Coral Island
books.author: R. M. Ballantyne
books.summary: Three shipwrecked youths encounter delights and dangers as they attempt to escape their uninhabited tropical island paradise.

books.title: She Stoops to Conquer
books.author: Oliver Goldsmith
books.summary: Two young men visit the countryside: one to find a wife, and the other to avoid one.

books.title: The Winter’s Tale
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A king’s unfounded jealousy destroys his family and kingdom.

books.title: A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur’s Court
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: An engineer from 19th-century Connecticut is sent back in time to King Arthur’s medieval England.

books.title: Gitanjali
books.author: Rabindranath Tagore
books.summary: Prose poems of offering translated by the author from the original Bengali.

books.title: Dracula
books.author: Bram Stoker
books.summary: An ancient undead monster terrorizes Victorian London.

books.title: The Life of Buffalo Bill
books.author: William F. Cody
books.summary: The 1879 autobiography of William F. Cody, more commonly known as Buffalo Bill, detailing his early life in the American West.

books.title: The Sign of the Four
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: An analytical detective is consulted by a young woman who has received a strange communication regarding her long-missing father and a mysterious treasure.

books.title: Democracy and Social Ethics
books.author: Jane Addams
books.summary: Jane Addams argues that addressing social issues like poverty and inequality requires shifting from individual morality to a collective understanding of social responsibility.

books.title: A Voice from the South
books.author: Anna Julia Cooper
books.summary: A Black woman from the American South philosophizes on various subjects.

books.title: New Hampshire
books.author: Robert Frost
books.summary: Robert Frost’s Pulitzer-winning book of poetry.

books.title: A Woman of No Importance
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A mother’s secretive past clashes with high society when her son is offered an irresistible position with a charismatic nobleman.

books.title: The Purple Cloud
books.author: M. P. Shiel
books.summary: A young adventurer embarks on a polar expedition, only to return to an unbelievably different world.

books.title: The Confessions of Arsène Lupin
books.author: Maurice Leblanc
books.summary: The gentleman-thief relates stories of his outwitting the Parisian detectives.

books.title: Religion and the Rise of Capitalism
books.author: R. H. Tawney
books.summary: A tracing of the development of religious thought from the Middle Ages to the dawn of the Industrial Revolution.

books.title: The Worst Journey in the World
books.author: Apsley Cherry-Garrard
books.summary: The travelogue of a member of Robert Scott’s ill-fated Antarctic expedition of 1910.
